step1.sentence: After arguing for an hour, she finally gave in and agreed to watch his favorite movie.

step2.story: The children begged their father for ice cream all afternoon, pulling his sleeve and making sad eyes. He tried to say no three times, but eventually gave in with a smile.

step3.story: Mark was determined to stick to his diet and turned down every snack at the party. His friends kept offering him a slice of birthday cake, saying just one bite would not hurt. He held firm for a while, but the smell of chocolate frosting was impossible to ignore. In the end, he gave in, took a big forkful, and decided the diet could wait until tomorrow.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 저항하거나 버티다가 결국 상대방의 요구나 압력에 따르다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 논쟁이나 압박에서 결국 상대의 뜻을 받아들일 때 사용합니다. 굴복하다, 양보하다에 해당합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: give(주다)와 in(안으로)이 결합하여 자신의 입장을 상대에게 넘겨준다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 처음에는 반대하다가 설득되거나 지쳐서 받아들이는 상황에 씁니다. 부정적이거나 중립적인 뉘앙스가 모두 가능합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She never gives in to peer pressure, no matter what.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 어떤 상황에서도 친구들의 압력에 굴복하지 않아요.
